channel.description: Storage DYI Labs Lab 13-1: Create and Remove Partitions with parted Create a 100MB primary partition on one of the available 250MB disks (lsblk) by invoking the parted utility directly at the command prompt. Apply label “msdos” if the disk is new. [root@server20 ~]# sudo parted /dev/sdb mklabel msdos Warning: The existing disk label on /dev/sdb will be destroyed and all data on this disk will be lost. Do you want to continue? Yes/No? yes Information: You may need to update /etc/fstab. [root@server20 ~]# sudo parted /dev/sdb mkpart primary 1 101m Information: You may need to update /etc/fstab. Create another 100MB partition by running parted interactively while ensuring that the second partition won’t overlap the first.
